SENT.plain: Congenital muscular dystrophy (CMD) is a heterogeneous group of neuromuscular disorders characterized by muscle weakness and hypotonia at birth or within the first few months of life
It is inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern
About half of the patients have a deficiency of the alpha-2-chain of laminin (merosin)
We describe a case of congenital muscular dystrophy in an infant with laminin-a2-chain deficiency, which appeared hypotonia in early infancy
Diagnosis was made by clinical features and the histological and immunohistochemical studies on muscle biopsy
